properties.headline: ATP Cup Tennis - Sat 1 to Sun 9 Jan - SYDNEY OLYMPIC PARK M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road approaching Qudos Bank Arena and Ken Rosewall Arena
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
ATP Cup Tennis at Qudos Bank Arena and Ken Rosewall Arena from Saturday 1 - Sunday 9 January. Day 1-6 matches from 10am and 5.30pm daily. Semi finals on Friday from 5.30pm and Saturday from 1pm. Sunday finals from 5.30pm.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd and Epping Rd as fans travel to the event.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park as fans travel to and from the game.

Pre-book parking at Sydney Olympic Park online to secure a space, available by 11.59pm the night before.

properties.headline: Cricket Test Match - Australia v England - MOORE PARK Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade, Lang Road, Eastern Distributor approaching Sydney Cricket Ground

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Moore Park transport and walking map
arrangementAttachments.fileName: 2021 Moore Park transport and walking map mar21.pdf
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Moore Park transport and walking map

properties.otherAdvice:
The Ashes Test Match: Australia v England at the SCG from 5-9 January. Play starts daily from 10am and finishes approximately 5.30pm, subject to weather conditions.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd approaching Moore Park as fans travel to and from the match each day so allow extra travel time.

Fans travelling from the north are reminded that the Cahill Expressway is closed southbound for roadwork, use the Sydney Harbour Tunnel or detour via the city to join the Eastern Distributor and continue towards Moore Park. 

Driver Ave is partially closed outside the stadium and will remain closed until crowds have safely cleared the precinct after the event.

Access Driver Ave EP3 grass car park or Entertainment Quarter car park via Lang Rd, motorists travelling from the Eastern Distributor should use the Randwick exit. Note EP2 grass car park is closed for days 4 and 5. 

Special event clearways are in effect from 6am to 7pm each day on sections of Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and RMS Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

SURRY HILLS / MOORE PARK FROM 3PM TO 11PM

  • Albion Street between Mary Street and Flinders Street (northern side)
  • Cleveland Street* between City Road and South Dowling Street
  • Fitzroy Street between South Dowling Street and Bourke Street (northern side)
  • Flinders Street between Albion Street and Moore Park Road (eastern side)
  • Foveaux Street between Bourke Street and Crown Street (northern side)
  • Lang Road between Cook Road and Anzac Parade (both sides)
  • Moore Park Road between Flinders Street and Driver Avenue (northern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Driver Avenue and Anzac Parade (southern side)

*existing clearways on Cleveland St will be extended to 11pm.
arrangementElements.title: Special Event Clearways

properties.headline: Special event - Saturday 22 January - KINGS CROSS Darlinghurst Road and Macleay Street
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Kings Cross road closure and clearways map
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Kings Cross road closure and clearways map

properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and special event clearways will be in place for a special event on Darlinghurst Rd and Macleay St starting from 11am until 10pm. 

To accommodate the event from 9am until 11:30pm road closures will be in place on; 

  • Darlinghurst Rd between Bayswater Rd and Macleay St
  • Macleay St between Darlinghurst Rd and Hughes St
  • Orwell St between Orwell Ln and Macleay St 

Special event clearways will also be in effect from 8am until 11:30pm on sections of Darlinghurst Rd, Macleay St, Orwell St, Ward Ave and Elizabeth Bay Rd. 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, and apply even to local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

Motorists in the area should allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways will be in effect on both sides of the roads below. Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

KINGS CROSS

FROM 8AM UNTIL 11:30PM

  • Darlinghurst Rd Between Bayswater Rd and Macleay St
  • Elizabeth Bay Rd Between Ward Ave and Elizabeth Bay Rd (Eastern side)
  • Elizabeth Bay Rd Between Baroda St and Birtley Pl (Western side)
  • Macleay St Between Darlinghurst Rd and Greenknowe Ave
  • Orwell St Between Orwell Ln and Macleay St (Northern side)
  • Ward Ave Between Kellett St and Roslyn St (Westernside)
  • Ward Ave Between Barncleuth Sq and Elizabeth Bay Rd (Eastern side)
  • Ward Ave Between Barncleuth Sq and Baroda St (Western side)

properties.headline: BBL - Saturday 15 January - MOORE PARK Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade, Lang Road, Eastern Distributor approaching The Sydney Cricket Ground

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Moore Park transport and walking map
arrangementAttachments.fileName: 2021 Moore Park transport and walking map mar21  SHUTTLES EP23.pdf
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Moore Park transport and walking map

properties.otherAdvice:
BBL: Sydney Sixers v Sydney Thunder at the SCG. Start from 7.40pm, finish around 10.45pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Moore Park as fans travel to the stadium.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 4.40pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.

Access EP3 grass car park on Driver Ave or Entertainment Quarter car park via Lang Rd. Motorists travelling south on the Eastern Distributor should use the Randwick exit. EP2 Kippax grass car park near Moore Park Rd will be open from 4.30pm. 

Special event clearways will be in effect from 3pm to midnight on sections of Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Flinders St, Chalmers St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

SURRY HILLS / MOORE PARK FROM 3PM TO MIDNIGHT

  • Albion Street between Mary Street and Flinders Street (northern side)
  • Albion Street between Bourke Street and Flinders Street (southern side)
  • Chalmers Street between Cleveland Street and Randle Street (western side)
  • Cleveland Street between South Dowling Street and City Road (both sides)
  • Flinders Street between Albion Street and Moore Park Road (eastern side)
  • Fitzroy Street between South Dowling Street and Bourke Street (northern side)
  • Foveaux Street between Bourke Street and Crown Street (northern side)
  • Lang Road between Cook Road and Anzac Parade (both sides)
  • Moore Park Road* between Driver Avenue and Anzac Parade (southern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Flinders Street and Greens Road (northern side)

*24 hour clearways are in effect on the southern side of Moore Park Road from Lang Road to Driver Avenue to support the pop-up cycleway.
arrangementElements.title: Special Event Clearways

Traffic may be heavier than usual in both directions on the Princes Hwy approaching Kogarah as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Local roads around the stadium will close before the game including Jubilee Ave, Park St and English St. Roads will re-open once crowds have cleared the area

Fans driving to the game should allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

Motorists should take care while travelling in the area and allow extra travel time.
